results.title: Clean cuisine
results.creator_credit: Mike O'Donnell, John Budd and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: An episode of ‘Countrywide’ where reporter Jill Singer examines the use of chemicals in Australian farming and the consequences of the presence of chemical residues in our food products.

results.title: Clay Modelling: The Human Face
results.brief_description: The human face in all its expressiveness is shown modelled from inanimate clay. This is a fascinating program for beginners, and for those with some experience, as it is packed with hints and useful information.

results.title: Clay
results.brief_description: Learn the basic techniques of pottery and ceramics and create objects like vases, piggy banks and pots. Highlights basic techniques such as creating a pinch pot, throwing on a wheel and solid construction as well as the art of glazing.

results.title: Claude Jutra: an unfinished story
results.creator_credit: Paule Baillargeon, Andre Theberge, Anne Frank, National Film Board of Canada, Production Docu 2 and Fox-Fire Films
results.brief_description: Claude Jutra (1930-1986) was an innovative Quebecois filmmaker who made some of Canadian cinema’s best known films including “Mon Oncle Antoine”, “A Chairy tale”, “A Tout prende”, “WOW” and “Kamouraska”. Paule Baillargeon; actress, director and friend; contemplates Jutra’s creative genius, his commitment to furthering French-Candian cultural identity, and his frustrated and difficult career. Through interviews with friends (including Bernardo Bertolucci and Saul Rubinek), film excerpts and extensive footage of the filmmaker himself, Jutra emerges as a sensitive, passionate man who gave his life completely to cinema. Faced with the decline of his faculties due to the onset of Alzheimer’s Disease, he took the decision to end his life aged 56. Some French with English subtitles.

results.title: Cleopatra Jones and the casino of gold
results.creator_credit: Chuck Bail, William Tennant and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Tamara Dobson reprises her role as special agent Cleopatra Jones, a martial arts crime buster, who’s fierce Kung Fu moves are only eclipsed by her outlandish dress sense and heavy eye make up (Dobson is credited as her own make up artist). In her latest adventure Cleopatra finds herself in Hong Kong, taking on the vast drug cartel which is run by the evil and aptly named Dragon Lady (Stella Stevens). Highlights from this blaxploitation action film include Cleopatra’s poor attempts at undercover work, a difficult task for a 6‘2 black woman in Hong Kong, made even more impossible by her outrageous choice of wardrobe and unbelievable head gear. Cast also includes Tanny, Norman Fell, Albert Popwell and Caro Kenyatta.

results.title: Clash of the titans
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis, Ray Harryhausen, Charles H. Schneer and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Harry Hamlin stars in this film as Perseus, the Greek mythological character, a gifted impetuous youth, sent on a heroic quest. His mission is to fight the deadly creature Kraken, a towering sea monster that is the last of the powerful Titans. If Perseus succeeds he will win the hand of the beautiful Andromeda, an imprisoned princess, and gain the ownership of half the kingdom. Having embarked on his quest, Perseus is aided by Pegasus, the winged horse and Ammon, a benevolent playwright. Laurence Olivier stars as the God Zeus and Maggie Smith as Thetis, a Greek Goddess with magical powers. Ray Harryhausen (who worked on Jason and the Argonauts) utilised his skills and experience to create stop animation for many sequences, which to modern CGI eyes can seem quite dated. Some impressive cinematography is let down by the clunky dialogue and inexpressive face of lead Harry Hamlin but the film is fun and provides a background to the wonderful world of Greek mythology. Conceived in the wake of the phenomenal success of “Star Wars”, “Clash of the titans” did not reach its expected audience who were flooding instead to the thrills of “Raiders of the lost ark”.

results.title: Clara [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Van Sowerine, Philippa Campey, Film Victoria and Film Camp
results.brief_description: An expressive although wordless evocation of a child’s grief, “Clara” uses silicone models and stop motion animation to portray a young girl’s reactions to the death of someone close. (Awards: Chicago International Film festival 2005, Best Animated Film, Cannes Film Festival 2005, Special Mention Best Short Film category)

results.title: Cityscape: impressions of a city
results.creator_credit: Ryan Larkin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An experiment, from NFB’s animation workshop, in creating continuous metamorphoses on the screen, employing charcoal drawings on a white board in a process of erasing, adding, photographing. In this film there is the impression of a succession of creatures moving across the screen, then disappearing into a hole. Eventually the hole changes to a bridge on which stands the youth who began the parade. Animation by Ryan Larkin. (Award: San Francisco)

results.title: City under pressure
results.creator_credit: Theodore Conant, Frank Spiller and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A case study of municipal government and the influence of citizens acting as a group. The study is of Edmonton, Canada, but the problems shown are common to many cities - urban renewal, traffic congestion, zoning etc. Listens in on discussion of these questions in Edmonton to provide ground for further discussion by the audience.

results.title: City slickers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ron Underwood, Irby Smith, Face Production, Nelson Entertainment and Castle Rock
results.brief_description: Boss breathing down your neck? Bank manager screaming? Family driving you crazy? Then it’s about time you took a break on the the wild west side! Die hard city fellas Mitch, Phil and Ed are edging 40 and desperately searching for their lost youth. When they try to recapture it with a two week cattle-driving vacation in the midwest they discover that playing cowboy is more than just ridin’, ropin’, and sleepin’ out under the stars. These city slickers thought surviving mid-life crisis was tough. That’s nothing compared to the ride they’re about to take. Stars Billy Crystal and Jack Palance in an endearing and funny adventure that will have the whole family in stitches.
